body_html:
Looking through the documentation for saver.restore it looks like the 'save_path' argument requires a path that was previously returned by saver.save() or save.latest_checkpoint(). Did you try passing in the path returned by save.latest_checkpoint()

// In addition to checkpoint files, savers keep a protocol buffer on disk with
// the list of recent checkpoints. This is used to manage numbered checkpoint
// files and by latest_checkpoint(), which makes it easy to discover the path
// to the most recent checkpoint. That protocol buffer is stored in a file named
// 'checkpoint' next to the checkpoint files.
